meanings.definition: Lack of proportion or proper relation
meanings.sent1: The disproportion in the sizes of the cakes was quite noticeable.
meanings.sent2: The artist tried to fix the disproportion in the painting by adjusting the proportions.
meanings.sent3: The disproportion between the number of cookies and the number of guests was comical.
meanings.sent4: The disproportion in their heights made them look like a comedy duo.
meanings.sent5: The disproportion in the room's lighting created a dramatic effect.

meanings.definition: To be out of proportion or out of balance
meanings.sent1: The weight of the luggage can disproportion the small car.
meanings.sent2: If you don't adjust the ingredients, the flavors will disproportion in the dish.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to juggle too many tasks may disproportion his work-life balance.
meanings.sent4: The loud music can disproportion your ability to focus on studying.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind can disproportion the carefully arranged sand sculptures.
